title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: State Police Sergeant Joel Daoust charged with assault during January 3 traffic stop in Springfield, faces two assault counts.
Incident involved excessive force, pepper spray on driver; Daoust suspended without pay pending arraignment on April 3.
Daoust previously disciplined in 2015 and 2017 for failing protocol and unsafe operation of police vehicle.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey announced the rollout of ChatGPT for the state's executive branch employees.
A Boston.com poll shows 65% of readers oppose Healey's decision, citing security and environmental concerns.
Gov. Healey defended the AI initiative, asserting it will enhance government efficiency and service delivery.

title: What a traveling nurse experienced on the hard-hit Cape after Monday’s blizzard
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Traveling nurse Colleen Wright navigated unplowed roads and downed trees on Cape Cod to reach her clients after the blizzard.
Cape Cod experienced power outages affecting nearly 160,000 residents; efforts reduced affected number to less than 50,000 by Thursday.
Four shelters remain open for elderly residents, with coordinated efforts for fuel and power restoration for critical facilities.

title: City Council rejects effort to ask Wu administration for info on ICE detainer requests
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Council rejected Ed Flynn's request for information on ICE detainer requests from the Wu administration.
Flynn's request sought details on detainers received since 2024, including the number and response from Boston Police.
Nine councilors opposed, citing concerns over narratives around immigrant safety, with three supporting Flynn's proposal.

title: Here’s why Boston streets seem clearer than after the last big storm
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston extended a parking ban after a recent blizzard to improve snow removal efficiency.
The city removed 200 truckloads of snow in one day by using daytime hours for clearance.
Boston considers a fee for property owners who fail to clear sidewalks post-storm, focusing on priority areas.

title: This Mass. bride and groom skied Killington fresh off their vows and in wedding attire
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Evan and Kristyn Brophy Stark skied down Killington Mountain in Vermont wearing wedding attire after their ceremony.
The Roxbury couple planned their wedding around a post-vows ski run, enjoying slopeside festivities with over 100 guests.
Their Killington wedding featured personalized ski-themed decorations, honoring their mutual love of skiing and winter.

title: Report: Anfernee Simons played with wrist fracture during time with Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Anfernee Simons revealed he played with a fractured wrist during his time with the Boston Celtics.
Simons was traded to the Chicago Bulls and has missed recent games due to the wrist injury.
The Celtics acquired Nikola Vucevic in the trade, who is averaging 9.9 points and 7.7 rebounds in seven games.

title: MBTA Commuter Rail experiences more delays due to snow cleanup and vehicle on track
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MBTA Commuter Rail experiences delays due to snow cleanup and a vehicle on the Worcester line tracks.
Service changes affected multiple lines including Fairmount, Lowell, and Newburyport/Rockport due to nearly three feet of snow.
Keolis Commuter Services continues cleanup efforts as weather-related issues impact Boston-area commuters' satisfaction with the MBTA.

title: All Mass. residents to get free access to Google AI training classes, Healey says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts residents can access free online AI and tech training courses through a new partnership with Google.
The courses, part of Google's Grow with Google program, typically cost $49 per month but are free until 2027.
Governor Maura Healey aims to make Massachusetts a leader in AI, allocating $100 million for AI business development.

title: Charlie McAvoy apologizes for Team USA’s reaction to Trump joke about US women’s team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy apologized for Team USA men's hockey team's reaction to a joke by Donald Trump about the US women's team.
After winning gold, Team USA men laughed at Trump's comment about inviting the women's team to the White House.
US women's hockey team declined Trump's White House invitation citing prior commitments; men visited and attended State of the Union.
